awd_titl_txt: Automatic Adaptive Scheduling of Processing in Multimachine Cells
awd_abstract_narration: The objective of this SBIR Phase I proposal is to study the                feasibility of automatically scheduling multi-machine complexes on a            real-time basis and implementing a unified computer system to                   provide new scheduling tools in automated systems.  Real-time                   scheduling by separating schedule generation and regeneration tasks             from schedule adaptation/recovery tasks will be investigated.  The              effectiveness of heuristics to automatically determine variable                 rescheduling periods, schedule adaptation/recovery procedures, and              schedule regeneration procedures will be explored.  This research               should lead to a new software product and is motivated by user                  requirements derived from applications of a current software                    product, FACTOR, which provides shop floor scheduling tools.  FACTOR            was developed under a prior SBIR grant.  If this Phase I research is            successful, a Phase II proposal will be submitted.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships
